instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: for testing purposes: board of 13" A1706 in 15" A1707 gives it picture?
threads.message:
I've a nice case and LCD of a A1707 which contains a completely damaged 820-00928 board (some broken ways and copper pads becomes loose when trying to solder).
I like to check if his LCD is still fully functional.

When I connect the 820-00923 board of my A1706 (see previous topic) on the LCD of the A1707, will this give me a picture?
T-Con connector to motherboard seems to be the same. Just the desired backlight voltage of the A1707 seems to be a little amount higher. I think I can't destroy anything?
Someone already tried this?

thanks!

threads.title: for testing purposes: board of 13" A1706 in 15" A1707 gives it picture?
threads.message: You should get image, that screen can be used for test.

threads.title: for testing purposes: board of 13" A1706 in 15" A1707 gives it picture?
threads.message:
Thanks, this gave me a clear Apple logo, so this screen should be OK.

When I open the screen further as 90°, I can see the flatcables becomes tight. Although it's not happened already, this is still a "flexgate" screen.
I will search for a good, or repairable board for the Macbook
But is there a known good workaround to prevent flexgate with this screen?
